meanings.definition: Collect and combine (information) in a structured way.
meanings.sent1: She collates all the data from the surveys to create a report.
meanings.sent2: The librarian collates the books on the shelves by genre.
meanings.sent3: The detective collates the clues to solve the mystery.
meanings.sent4: Her mind collates memories like a well-organized filing cabinet.
meanings.sent5: The chef collates ingredients to create a delicious dish.

meanings.definition: Compare and analyze (different items) for similarities and differences.
meanings.sent1: He collates the prices of various products before making a purchase.
meanings.sent2: The teacher collates the test scores to identify patterns in student performance.
meanings.sent3: The kids collate their toy collections to see who has the most.
meanings.sent4: The scientist collates data from multiple experiments to draw conclusions.
meanings.sent5: The artist collates colors to find the perfect palette for the painting.
